intro: Chaetolepis phelpsiae subsp. chimantensis, commonly known as the Chimanté Chaetolepis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in cloud forests at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
